tags.name: User Setting
tags.description: This module defines all API routes with for user settings.

tags.name: Site settings
tags.description: This module defines all API routes with for site settings.

tags.name: Assignment
tags.description: All routes to used to manipulate and retrieve assignment objects and their relations.

tags.name: AutoTest
tags.description: This module defines all API routes with the main directory "auto\_tests". The APIs are used to create, start, and request information about AutoTests.

tags.name: Course
tags.description: All routes to used to manipulate and retrieve course objects and their relations.

tags.name: About
tags.description: This module defines all API routes with the main directory "about". Thus the APIs in this module are mostly used get information about the instance running psef.

tags.name: User
tags.description: This module defines all API routes with the main directory "login". This APIs are used to handle starting and closing the user session and update the :class: User object of the logged in user.

tags.name: Group
tags.description: This module defines all routes needed to manipulate a single group.

APICodes.description: Internal API codes that are used by APIException objects.

request_id.description: The id of the request that went wrong. Please include this id when reporting bugs.

possible_values.description: The possible values for each option.

explanation.description: The explanation when these kinds of notifications occur.

value.description: The current value for this notification reason.

NotificationSettingOptionJSON.description: The JSON serialization schema for a single notification setting option.

NotificationReasons.description: The reason a user received a notification.

EmailNotificationTypes.description: The possible options for preferences for sending email notifications.

reason.description: For what type notification do you want to change the settings.

value.description: The new value of the notification setting.

name.description: The ui preference you want to change.

value.description: The new value of the preference.

AUTO_TEST_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL.description: The amount of time there can be between two heartbeats of a runner. Changing this to a lower value might cause some runners to crash.

AUTO_TEST_HEARTBEAT_MAX_MISSED.description: The max amount of heartbeats that we may miss from a runner before we kill it and start a new one.

AUTO_TEST_MAX_JOBS_PER_RUNNER.description: This value determines the amount of runners we request for a single assignment. The amount of runners requested is equal to the amount of students not yet started divided by this value.

AUTO_TEST_MAX_CONCURRENT_BATCH_RUNS.description: The maximum amount of batch AutoTest runs we will do at a time. AutoTest batch runs are runs that are done after the deadline for configurations that have hidden tests. Increasing this variable might cause heavy server load.

MIN_PASSWORD_SCORE.description: The minimum strength passwords by users should have. The higher this value the stronger the password should be. When increasing the strength all users with too weak passwords will be shown a warning on the next login.

RESET_TOKEN_TIME.description: The amount of time a reset token is valid. You should not increase this value too much as users might be not be too careful with these tokens. Increasing this value will allow **all** existing tokens to live longer.

SETTING_TOKEN_TIME.description: The amount of time the link send in notification emails to change the notification preferences works to actually change the notifications.

MAX_NUMBER_OF_FILES.description: The maximum amount of files and directories allowed in a single archive.

MAX_LARGE_UPLOAD_SIZE.description: The maximum size of uploaded files that are mostly uploaded by "trusted" users. Examples of these kind of files include AutoTest fixtures and plagiarism base code.

MAX_NORMAL_UPLOAD_SIZE.description: The maximum total size of uploaded files that are uploaded by normal users. This is also the maximum total size of submissions. Increasing this size might cause a hosting costs to increase.

MAX_FILE_SIZE.description: The maximum size of a single file uploaded by normal users. This limit is really here to prevent users from uploading extremely large files which can't really be downloaded/shown anyway.

JWT_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES.description: The time a login session is valid. After this amount of time a user will always need to re-authenticate.

Opt.AllOptsAsJSON.description: The JSON representation of all options.

AUTO_TEST_MAX_TIME_COMMAND.description: The default amount of time a step/substep in AutoTest can run. This can be overridden by the teacher.

EXAM_LOGIN_MAX_LENGTH.description: The maximum time-delta an exam may take. Increasing this value also increases the maximum amount of time the login tokens send via email are valid. Therefore, you should make this too long.

LOGIN_TOKEN_BEFORE_TIME.description: This determines how long before the exam we will send the login emails to the students (only when enabled of course).

SITE_EMAIL.description: The email shown to users as the email of CodeGrade.

MAX_LINES.description: The maximum amount of lines that we should in render in one go. If a file contains more lines than this we will show a warning asking the user what to do.

NOTIFICATION_POLL_TIME.description: The amount of time to wait between two consecutive polls to see if a user has new notifications. Setting this value too low will cause unnecessary stres on the server.

RELEASE_MESSAGE_MAX_TIME.description: What is the maximum amount of time after a release a message should be shown on the HomeGrid. **Note**: this is the amount of time after the release, not after this instance has been upgraded to this release.

BLACKBOARD_ZIP_UPLOAD_ENABLED.description: If enabled teachers are allowed to bulk upload submissions (and create users) using a zip file in a format created by Blackboard.

RUBRICS_ENABLED.description: If enabled teachers can use rubrics on CodeGrade. Disabling this feature will not delete existing rubrics.

INCREMENTAL_RUBRIC_SUBMISSION_ENABLED.description: Should rubrics be submitted incrementally, so if a user selects a item should this be automatically be submitted to the server, or should it only be possible to submit a complete rubric at once. This feature is useless if rubrics is not set to true.

REGISTER_ENABLED.description: Should it be possible to register on the website. This makes it possible for any body to register an account on the website.

COURSE_REGISTER_ENABLED.description: Should it be possible for teachers to create links that users can use to register in a course. Links to enroll can be created even if this feature is disabled.

RENDER_HTML_ENABLED.description: Should it be possible to render html files within CodeGrade. This opens up more attack surfaces as it is now possible by design for students to run javascript. This is all done in a sandboxed iframe but still.

EMAIL_STUDENTS_ENABLED.description: Should it be possible to email students.

Opt.FrontendOptsAsJSON.description: The JSON representation of options visible to all users.

updates.description: The items you want to update

cgignore_version.description: The version of the cignore file.

whitespace_linter.description: Has the whitespace linter run on this assignment.

available_at.description: The time the assignment will become available (i.e. the state will switch from 'hidden' to 'open'). If the state is not 'hidden' this value has no meaning. If this value is not None you cannot change to state to 'hidden' or 'open'.

send_login_links.description: Should we send login links to all users before the available\_at time.

fixed_max_rubric_points.description: The fixed value for the maximum that can be achieved in a rubric. This can be higher and lower than the actual max. Will be null if unset.

max_grade.description: The maximum grade you can get for this assignment. This is based around the idea that a 10 is a 'perfect' score. So if this value is 12 a user can score 2 additional bonus points. If this value is null it is unset and regarded as a 10.

group_set.description: The group set of this assignment. This is null if this assignment is not a group assignment.

auto_test_id.description: The id of the AutoTest configuration connected to this assignment. This will always be given if there is a configuration connected to this assignment, even if you do not have permission to see the configuration itself.

files_upload_enabled.description: Can you upload files to this assignment.

webhook_upload_enabled.description: Can you connect git to this assignment

max_submissions.description: The maximum amount of submission a student may create, inclusive. The value null indicates that there is no limit.

cool_off_period.description: The time period in which a person can submit at most amount\_in\_cool\_off\_period amount.

amount_in_cool_off_period.description: The maximum amount of time a user can submit within amount\_in\_cool\_off\_period. This value is always \>= 0, if this value is 0 a user can submit an unlimited amount of time.

reminder_time.description: ISO UTC date. This will be null if you don't have the permission to see this or if it is unset.

lms_name.description: The LMS providing this LTI assignment.

peer_feedback_settings.description: The peer feedback settings for this assignment. If null this assignment is not a peer feedback assignment.

done_type.description: The kind of reminder that will be sent. If you don't have the permission to see this it will always be null If this is not set it will also be null.

done_email.description: The email where the done email will be sent to. This will be null if you do not have permission to see this information.

division_parent_id.description: The assignment id of the assignment that determines the grader division of this assignment. This will be null if you do not have permissions to see this information, or if no such parent is set.

analytics_workspace_ids.description: The ids of the analytics workspaces connected to this assignment. WARNING: This API is still in beta, and might change in the future.

kind.description: What kind of assignment is this.

Assignment.AsJSON.description:
The serialization of an assignment.

See the comments in the source code for the meaning of each field.

policy.description: The default policy of this validator.

rules.description: The rules in this validator. If the policy is "deny\_all\_files" this should not be empty.

SubmissionValidator.InputData.description: The input data for the SubmissionValidator ignore type.

file_type.description: The type of files this rule should apply to.

name.description: The pattern that describes which files this rule should apply to. This cannot be empty.

FileRule.InputData.description: The input data for a single file rule for the SubmissionValidator.

Options.InputData.description: The input data for a single option for the SubmissionValidator.

id.description: The id of this group set.

minimum_size.description: The minimum size a group should be before it can submit work.

maximum_size.description: The maximum size a group can be.

assignment_ids.description: The ids of the assignments connected to this group set.

GroupSet.AsJSON.description: The way this class will be represented in JSON.

amount.description: The amount of student that a single user should peer review.

time.description: The amount of time in seconds a user has after the deadline to do the peer review.

auto_approved.description: Should new peer feedback comments be considered approved by default or not.

AssignmentKind.description: Describes in what state an .Assignment is.

fixtures.description: The fixtures connected to this AutoTest

run_setup_script.description: The setup script that will be executed before any test starts.

setup_script.description: The setup script that will be executed for each student. In this script the submission of the student is available.

grade_calculation.description: The way the grade is calculated in this AutoTest. This is null if the options is still unset. This can be 'full' or 'partial'.

sets.description: The sets in this AutoTest. In the UI these are called levels.

assignment_id.description: The id of the assignment to which this AutoTest belongs.

runs.description: The runs done with this AutoTest. This is list is always of length 0 or 1

results_always_visible.description: If true This is null if the options is still unset.

prefer_teacher_revision.description: If true This is null if the options is still unset.

name.description: The local name of this file, this does **not** include any parent directory names, nor does it include trailing slashes for directories.

FileMixin.AsJSON.description: The base JSON representation of a file.

suites.description: The suites connected to this set. In the UI these are called "categories"

stop_points.description: A floating indicating the minimum percentage of points a student should achieve after this set (or "level"). If this percentage is not achieved the AutoTest will stop running.

steps.description: The steps that will be executed in this suite.

rubric_row.description: The rubric row this category is connected to.

network_disabled.description: Is the network disabled while running this category.

submission_info.description: Will submission info be available while running this step.

command_time_limit.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds a step (or substep) may take. If null the instance default will be used.

type.description: The type of AutoTest step. We constantly add new step types, so don't try to store this as an enum.

weight.description: The amount of weight this step should have.

hidden.description: Is this step hidden? If true in most cases students will not be able to see this step and its details.

data.description: The data used to run this step. The data shape is dependent on your permissions and the step type.

AutoTestStepBase.AsJSONBase.description: The base JSON for a step, used for both input and output.

id.description: The id of this row, used for updating

description_type.description: The type of descriptions in this row.

items.description: The item in this row. The length will always be 1 for continuous rubric rows.

locked.description: Is this row locked. If it is locked you cannot update it, nor can you manually select items in it.

RubricRowBase.AsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a rubric row.

RubricDescriptionType.description: The type of formatting used for the description of a rubric row or item.

id.description: The id of this rubric item.

RubricItem.AsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a rubric item.

points.description: The amount of points a user gets when this item is selected.

RubricItem.AsJSONBase.description: The base serialization of a rubric item.

created_at.description: The moment the run was created.

state.description: The state it is in. This is only kept for backwards compatibility reasons, it will always be "running".

is_continuous.description: Also not used anymore, will always be false.

FixtureLike.description: A AutoTest fixture where only the id is required.

setup_script.description: The new setup script (per student) of the auto test.

run_setup_script.description: The new run setup script (global) of the auto test.

has_new_fixtures.description: If true all other files in the request will be used as new fixtures

grade_calculation.description: The way to do grade calculation for this AutoTest.

results_always_visible.description: Should results be visible for students before the assignment is set to "done"?

prefer_teacher_revision.description: If `true` we will use the teacher revision if available when running tests.

fixtures.description: A list of old fixtures you want to keep

assignment_id.description: The id of the assignment in which you want to create this AutoTest. This assignment should have a rubric.

assignments.description: The assignments connected to this assignment.

group_sets.description: The groups sets of this course.

Course.AsExtendedJSON.description: The way this class will be represented in extended JSON.

iss.description: The iss configured for this provider.

LTI1p3Provider.BaseAsJSON.description: The base representation of an LTI 1.3 provider.

id.description: The id of this LTI provider.

lms.description: The LMS that is connected as this LTI provider.

created_at.description: The time this LTI provider was created.

intended_use.description: Who will use this LTI provider.

LTIProviderBase.BaseAsJSON.description: The base JSON representation for an LTI 1.1 provider.

finalized.description: This is a non finalized provider.

auth_login_url.description: The auth login url, if already configured.

auth_token_url.description: The auth token url, if already configured.

client_id.description: The client id, if already configured.

key_set_url.description: The url where we can download the keyset of the LMS, if already configured.

auth_audience.description: The auth audience, if already configured.

custom_fields.description: Custom fields that the LMS should provide when launching.

public_jwk.description: The public JWK for this provider, this should be provided to the LMS.

public_key.description: The public key for this provider, this should be provided to the LMS.

edit_secret.description: If you have the permission to edit this provider this will be a key with which you can do that.

LTI1p3Provider.NonFinalizedAsJSON.description: A non finalized provider as JSON.

finalized.description: This is a already finalized provider and thus is actively being used.

LTI1p1Provider.FinalizedAsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a finalized provider.

LTI1p1Provider.BaseAsJSON.description: The base JSON representation of a LTI 1.1 provider.

finalized.description: This is a non finalized provider, so it cannot yet be used for launches.

edit_secret.description: If you have the permission to edit this provider this will be a key with which you can do that.

lms_consumer_key.description: The consumer key used to connect the provider to an LMS.

lms_consumer_secret.description: The shared secret used to connect the provider to an LMS.

LTI1p1Provider.NonFinalizedAsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a non finalized provider.

CourseState.description: Describes in what state a .Course is.

value.description: The value of this snippet, i.e. what this snippet should expand to.

CourseSnippet.AsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a course snippet.

created_at.description: The date this course was created

is_lti.description: Is this an LTI course? Deprecated: Use the lti\_provider attribute (and check for null).

lti_provider.description: The lti provider that manages this course, if null this is not a LTI course.

state.description: The state this course is in.

Course.AsJSON.description: The way this class will be represented in JSON.

health.description: Health information, will only be present when the correct (secret) health key is provided.

LegacyFeaturesAsJSON.description:
The legacy features of CodeGrade.

Please don't use this object, but instead check for enabled settings.

version.description: What version is running, this key might not be present.

date.description: What date was the version released.

message.description: A small message about the new features of this release.

ui_preference.description: What ui\_preference controls if we should show the release message.

ReleaseInfo.description: Information about the release running on the server.

commit.description: The commit which is running on this server.

BaseReleaseInfo.description: The part of the release info that will always be present.

uploads.description: Is the upload storage system ok?

mirror_uploads.description: Is the mirror upload storage system ok?

temp_dir.description: Is the temporary directory on this server ok?

HealthAsJSON.description: Information about the health of this instance.

version.description: What version is running on this server. Deprecated, please use version instead.

commit.description: The commit this server is running. Deprecated, please use commit instead.

features.description: The features enabled on this instance. Deprecated, please use settings.

settings.description: The frontend settings and their values for this instance.

release.description: Information about the release running on this server.

BaseAboutAsJSON.description: The base information about this instance.

email.description: The email of the user. This will only be provided for the currently logged in user.

hidden.description: Can this user see hidden assignments at least in one course.

User.AsExtendedJSON.description: The extended JSON representation of a user.

group_set_id.description: The id of the group set that this group is connected to.

created_at.description: The datetime this group was created.

id.description: The is the id of this user

name.description: The fullname of the user. This might contain a first and last name, however this is not guaranteed.

is_test_student.description: Is this user a test student.

User.AsJSONWithoutGroup.description: The JSON representation of a user without the `group` property.

group.description: If this user is a wrapper user for a group this will contain this group, otherwise it will be null.

User.AsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a user.

user.description: The user that was logged in.

access_token.description: A JWT token that can be used to do authenticated requests.

ResultDataPostUserLogin.description: When logging in this object will be given.

anyOf.description: The data required when you want to login

username.description: The username of the user you want to impersonate

anyOf.description: The data required when you want to impersonate a user

setup_stdout.description: The stdout produced in the student setup script.

setup_stderr.description: The stderr produced in the student setup script.

step_results.description: The results for each step in this AutoTest. The ordering of this list is arbitrary, and the results for entire suites and or sets might be missing.

approx_waiting_before.description: If the result has not started this will contain the amount of students we expect we still need to run before this result is next. This might be incorrect and should only be used as a rough estimate.

final_result.description: If true this is the final result for the student, meaning that without teacher interaction (e.g. restarting the AutoTest) this result will not change and will be used as is to calculate the grade of the student. Reasons why this may not be the case include but are not limited to the test containing hidden steps that will only be run after the deadline.

suite_files.description: A mapping between suite id and the files written to the AutoTest output folder in that suite.

AutoTestResult.AsExtendedJSON.description: The extended JSON representation of a result.

AutoTestStepResultState.description:
This enum represents the states the result of a step can be in.

A single step result will probably be in multiple states during its existence.

id.description: The id of the result of a step

auto_test_step.description: The step this is the result of.

state.description: The state this result is in.

achieved_points.description: The amount of points achieved by the student in this step.

log.description: The log produced by this result. The format of this log depends on the step result.

started_at.description: The time this result was started, if null the result hasn't started yet.

attachment_id.description: The id of the attachment produced by this result. If null no attachment was produced.

entries.description: The entries in this directory. This is a list that will contain all children of the directory. This key might not be present, in which case the file is not a directory.

id.description: The id of the file, this can be used to retrieve it later on.

name.description: The name of the file, this does not include the name of any parents.

created_at.description: The time this result was created

started_at.description: The moment this result was started. If this is null the result has not yet started.

work_id.description: The id of the submission (work) that was tested in this result.

state.description: The state the result is in.

points_achieved.description: The amount of points achieved in this step by the student.

AutoTestResult.AsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a result.

id.description: The id of the step. Provide this if you want to edit an existing step. If not provided a new step will be created.

AutoTestStepBase.InputAsJSON.description: The input data needed for a new AutoTest step.

id.description: The id of the suite you want to edit. If not provided we will create a new suite.

steps.description: The steps that should be in this suite. They will be run as the order they are provided in.

rubric_row_id.description: The id of the rubric row that should be connected to this suite.

network_disabled.description: Should the network be disabled when running steps in this suite

submission_info.description: If passed as `true` Defaults to `false` when creating new suites.

command_time_limit.description: The maximum amount of time a single step (or substeps) can take when running tests. If not provided the default value is depended on configuration of the instance.

id.description: The id, pass this to update an existing row, omit it to create a new row.

type.description: The type of rubric row. Will default to "normal" if not passed.

RubricRowBase.InputAsJSON.description: The JSON needed to update a rubric row.

id.description: The id of this rubric item. Pass this to update an existing rubric item, omit if you want to create a new item.

RubricItem.InputAsJSON.description: The JSON needed to update a rubric item.

RubricRowBase.InputAsJSONBase.description: The required part of the input data for a rubric row.

max_points.description: The maximum amount of points you need to get for this rubric for full mark (i.e. a 10). By passing `null` you reset this value, by not passing it you keep its current value.'

rows.description: The rubric rows of this assignment. This will be the entire rubric, so to delete a row simply don't pass it in this list.

old_assignment_id.description: The id of the assignment from which you want to copy the rubric.

stop_points.description: The minimum percentage a student should have achieved before the next tests will be run.

results.description: The results in this run. This will only contain the result for the latest submissions.

setup_stdout.description: The stdout output of the run\_setup\_script

setup_stderr.description: The stderr output of the run\_setup\_script

assignment_id.description: The id of the assignment into which you want to copy this AutoTest.

expiration_date.description: The moment this link will stop working

role.description: The role new users will get

allow_register.description: Can users register with this link

CourseRegistrationLink.AsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a course registration link.

course.description: The course this role is connected to

CourseRole.AsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a course role.

AbstractRole.AsJSON.description: The JSON representation of a role.

id.description: The id of the link to edit, omit to create a new link.

role_id.description: The id of the role that users should get when enrolling with this link.

expiration_date.description: The date this link should stop working.

allow_register.description: Should students be allowed to register a new account using this link. For registration to actually work this feature should be enabled.

AssignmentStateEnum.description: Describes in what state an .Assignment is.

AssignmentDoneType.description: Describes what type of reminder should be sent.

state.description: The new state of the assignment

name.description: The new name of the assignment

deadline.description: The new deadline of the assignment

max_grade.description: The maximum possible grade for this assignment. You can reset this by passing `null` as value

group_set_id.description: The group set id for this assignment. Set to `null` to make this assignment not a group assignment

available_at.description: The time the assignment should become available

send_login_links.description: Should we send login links to students before the assignment opens. This is only available for assignments with 'kind' equal to 'exam'

files_upload_enabled.description: Should students be allowed to make submissions by uploading files

webhook_upload_enabled.description: Should students be allowed to make submissions using git webhooks

max_submissions.description: The maximum amount of submissions a user may create.

cool_off_period.description: The amount of time in seconds there should be between `amount_in_cool_off_period + 1` submissions.

amount_in_cool_off_period.description: The maximum amount of submissions that can be made within `cool_off_period` seconds. This should be higher than or equal to 1.

ignore_version.description: The ignore version to use, defaults to "IgnoreFilterManager".

done_type.description: How to determine grading is done for this assignment, this value is not used when `reminder_time` is `null`.

reminder_time.description: At what time should we send the reminder emails to the graders. This value is not used wehn `done_type` is `null`.

done_email.description: A list of emails that should receive an email when grading is done. This value has no effect when `done_type` is set to `null`.

setup_script.description: The new setup script (per student) of the auto test.

run_setup_script.description: The new run setup script (global) of the auto test.

has_new_fixtures.description: If true all other files in the request will be used as new fixtures

grade_calculation.description: The way to do grade calculation for this AutoTest.

results_always_visible.description: Should results be visible for students before the assignment is set to "done"?

prefer_teacher_revision.description: If `true` we will use the teacher revision if available when running tests.

fixtures.description: A list of old fixtures you want to keep
The fixtures connected to this AutoTest

run_setup_script.description: The setup script that will be executed before any test starts.

setup_script.description: The setup script that will be executed for each student. In this script the submission of the student is available.

grade_calculation.description: The way the grade is calculated in this AutoTest. This is null if the options is still unset. This can be 'full' or 'partial'.

sets.description: The sets in this AutoTest. In the UI these are called levels.

assignment_id.description: The id of the assignment to which this AutoTest belongs.

runs.description: The runs done with this AutoTest. This is list is always of length 0 or 1

results_always_visible.description: If true This is null if the options is still unset.

prefer_teacher_revision.description: If true This is null if the options is still unset.

name.description: The new name of the course

state.description: The new state of the course, currently you cannot set the state of a course to 'deleted'

virtual_user.description: The virtual user connected to this course. It will not contain the group key as this would lead to an infinite recursion.

IncorrectPermissionsError.description: You do not have the necessary permission to this

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token is missing or invalid
